meanings.definition: Assigning a new tag or label to something.
meanings.sent1: I am retagging my books to organize them better.
meanings.sent2: She retagged the items in the store for the sale.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept retagging its toys with different names.
meanings.sent4: The students were retagging their memories with colorful labels.
meanings.sent5: Retagging the files made finding them much easier.

meanings.definition: Changing the tag or label on something.
meanings.sent1: He is retagging the prices on the products.
meanings.sent2: After the event, they retagged the leftover items.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel kept retagging the bird feeders.
meanings.sent4: The storm retagged the landscape with a blanket of snow.
meanings.sent5: Retagging the map with new locations helped them navigate better.
